    • Constructor Detail

      • IntPriorityQueue

        public IntPriorityQueue(int arraySize)
        Initialize an empty IntPriorityQueue with a specified array size.
        Parameters:
        arraySize - the array size for this new Priority Queue Precondition: arraySize > 0 IntPriorityQueue: This queue is empty and has the specified array size.
        Throws:
        java.lang.OutOfMemoryError - Indicates insufficient memory for the specified array size.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Indicates that arraySize is not positive.

    • Method Detail

      • add

        public void add(int data,
                int priority)
        Add a new node to the heap, based on the priority.
        Parameters:
        data - the data (type int) of the new node.
        priority - the priority (type int) of the new node to be added. Precondition: Both data and priorirty is an int.

      • remove

        public IntPriorityQueue.PQNode remove()
        Removes the node from the heap.
        Returns:
        Remove the highest priority node from the heap; heap property maintained. Return the highest priority node.

      • showHighestPriority

        public int showHighestPriority()
        Show the priority of the node with highest priority.
        Returns:
        The priority of the node with highest priority.

      • showFirstData

        public int showFirstData()
        Show the data of the node with highest priority.
        Returns:
        The data of the node with highest priority.

      • displayHeap

        public void displayHeap()
        Display the elements in the heap (array) in array format (Eg. [3,2,1]).

      • isEmpty

        public boolean isEmpty()
        Check if the heap (array) is empty
        Returns:
        true if and only if the heap is empty
